Title: A quantified nitrogen metabolic network by reaction kinetics and mathematical model in a single-stage microaerobic system treating low COD/TN wastewater
Authors: Zhenju Sun, Jianzheng Li, Yiyang Fan, Jia Meng
Abstract: A single-stage intermittent aeration microaerobic reactor (IAMR) has been developed for the cost-effective nitrogen removal from piggery wastewater with a low ratio of chemical oxygen demand (COD) to total nitrogen (TN). In this study, a quantified nitrogen metabolic network was constructed based on the metagenomics, reaction kinetics and mathematical model to provide a revealing insight into the nitrogen removal mechanism in the IAMR. Metagenomics revealed that a complex nitrogen metabolic network, including aerobic ammonia and nitrite oxidation, anammox, denitrification via nitrate and nitrite, and nitrate respiration, existed in the IAMR. A novel method for solving kinetic parameters with high stability was developed based on a genetic algorithm. Use this method to calculate the kinetics of various reactions involved in nitrogen metabolism. Kinetics revealed that simultaneous partial nitritation-anammox (PN/A) and partial denitrification-anammox (PDN/A) were the dominant approaches to nitrogen removal in the IAMR. Finally, a kinetics-based model was proposed for quantitatively describing the nitrogen metabolic network under the limitation of COD. 58% ~ 67% of nitrogen was removed via the anammox-based processes (PN/A and PDN/A), but only 7% ~ 12% and 1% ~ 2% of nitrogen were removed via heterotrophic denitrification of nitrite and nitrate, respectively. The half-inhibition constant of dissolved oxygen (DO) on anammox was simulated as 0.37 ~ 0.60 mg L− 1, filling the gap in quantifying DO inhibition on anammox. High-frequency intermittent aeration was identified as the crucial measure to suppress nitrite-oxidizing bacteria, although it has a high affinity for DO and NO2− -N. In continuous aeration mode, the simulated NO3− -N in the IAMR would rise by 39.6%. The research provides a novel insight into the nitrogen removal mechanism in single-stage microaerobic systems and provides a reliable approach to practicing PN/A and PDN/A for cost-effective nitrogen removal.
GEMINI_What_problem_does_this_paper_atte: - The nitrogen metabolism in single-stage microaerobic processes is complex and involves combined kinetics of various reactions. - The nitrogen metabolic network in the microaerobic process is not yet quantified. - There is a need to clarify the nitrogen metabolic networks for insight into the nitrogen removal mechanism in single-stage microaerobic processes treating low COD/TN wastewater. - Traditional linear fitting algorithms for Monod kinetics are susceptible to measurement errors, requiring a more stable algorithm.
GEMINI_How_the_paper_solves_this_problem: - Constructed a single-stage intermittent aeration microaerobic reactor (IAMR) to treat piggery wastewater. - Used metagenomic sequencing to reveal orthologous genes and metabolic pathways involved in nitrogen metabolism. - Conducted kinetic assays (oxygen uptake rate, transformation rates of $$NH_4^+$$ -N, $$NO_2^-$$ -N, $$NO_3^-$$ -N, and interaction assays) to understand reaction kinetics. - Developed a novel, high-stability algorithm based on the finite element method and genetic algorithm (GA) to solve kinetic parameters ($$\mu_{max}$$ and $$K_S$$). - Proposed a kinetics-based mathematical model incorporating a COD limitation correction factor ($$f_{COD}$$) and DO inhibition equations to quantify the nitrogen metabolic network.
GEMINI_What_experiments_were_done_for_th: - Continuous operation of a lab-scale IAMR for 57 days treating SBR-pretreated piggery wastewater. - Chemical analysis of COD, $$NH_4^+$$ -N, $$NO_2^-$$ -N, $$NO_3^-$$ -N, TKN, MLSS, MLVSS, TN, DO, and pH. - Metagenomic sequencing of the activated sludge to identify KEGG metabolic pathways and orthologous genes. - Kinetic assays in three groups: 1) Oxygen uptake rate (OUR) in aerobic oxidation of $$NH_4^+$$ -N, $$NO_2^-$$ -N, and COD; 2) Transformation rate of $$NH_4^+$$ -N, $$NO_2^-$$ -N, and $$NO_3^-$$ -N under aerobic/anaerobic conditions; 3) Interaction of anammox with heterotrophic nitrite denitrification or nitrate respiration.
GEMINI_What_are_the_points_that_can_be_e: - The application of the proposed kinetics-based mathematical model and GA algorithm to full-scale wastewater treatment plants. - Long-term stability of the simultaneous PN/A and PDN/A processes under fluctuating influent conditions (e.g., varying COD/TN ratios or temperature). - Further investigation into the specific microbial community dynamics and their interactions under different intermittent aeration frequencies.
GEMINI_Summarize_the_main_points_of_the_: - A quantified nitrogen metabolic network was successfully constructed for a single-stage IAMR treating low COD/TN wastewater. - A novel GA-based algorithm was developed to reliably estimate Monod kinetic parameters, overcoming the limitations of traditional linear fitting. - Simultaneous partial nitritation-anammox (PN/A) and partial denitrification-anammox (PDN/A) were identified as the dominant nitrogen removal pathways (removing 58%~67% of nitrogen). - The DO half-inhibition constant for anammox was calibrated to 0.37 ~ 0.60 mg $$L^{-1}$$. - Intermittent aeration is crucial for suppressing nitrite-oxidizing bacteria (NOB) and preventing $$NO_3^-$$ -N accumulation.

zh_Abstract: 开发了一种单级间歇曝气微好氧反应器（IAMR），用于从化学需氧量（COD）与总氮（TN）比值较低的猪场废水中经济高效地脱氮。在本研究中，基于宏基因组学、反应动力学和数学模型构建了量化的氮代谢网络，以深入揭示IAMR中的脱氮机制。宏基因组学表明，IAMR中存在复杂的氮代谢网络，包括好氧氨和亚硝酸盐氧化、厌氧氨氧化、经由硝酸盐和亚硝酸盐的反硝化以及硝酸盐呼吸。开发了一种基于遗传算法的高稳定性求解动力学参数的新方法。使用该方法计算参与氮代谢的各种反应的动力学。动力学表明，同步短程硝化-厌氧氨氧化（PN/A）和短程反硝化-厌氧氨氧化（PDN/A）是IAMR中脱氮的主要途径。最后，提出了一种基于动力学的模型，用于定量描述COD限制下的氮代谢网络。58% ~ 67%的氮通过基于厌氧氨氧化的工艺（PN/A和PDN/A）去除，但只有7% ~ 12%和1% ~ 2%的氮分别通过亚硝酸盐和硝酸盐的异养反硝化去除。溶解氧（DO）对厌氧氨氧化的半抑制常数被模拟为0.37 ~ 0.60 mg L− 1，填补了量化DO对厌氧氨氧化抑制作用的空白。高频间歇曝气被确定为抑制亚硝酸盐氧化菌的关键措施，尽管其对DO和NO2− -N具有高亲和力。在连续曝气模式下，IAMR中模拟的NO3− -N将增加39.6%。该研究为单级微好氧系统中的脱氮机制提供了新的见解，并为实践PN/A和PDN/A以实现经济高效的脱氮提供了可靠的方法。
GEMINI_zh_What_problem_does_this_paper_a: - 单级微好氧工艺中的氮代谢非常复杂，涉及多种反应的组合动力学。 - 微好氧工艺中的氮代谢网络尚未被定量化。 - 需要阐明氮代谢网络，以深入了解处理低COD/TN废水的单级微好氧工艺中的脱氮机制。 - 传统的Monod动力学线性拟合算法容易受到测量误差的影响，需要一种更稳定的算法。
GEMINI_zh_How_the_paper_solves_this_prob: - 构建了单级间歇曝气微好氧反应器（IAMR）来处理猪场废水。 - 利用宏基因组测序揭示参与氮代谢的直系同源基因和代谢途径。 - 进行了动力学实验（包括需氧量、$$NH_4^+$$ -N、$$NO_2^-$$ -N、$$NO_3^-$$ -N在好氧/厌氧条件下的转化率以及相互作用实验）以了解反应动力学。 - 开发了一种基于有限元方法和遗传算法（GA）的新型高稳定性算法，用于求解动力学参数（$$\mu_{max}$$和$$K_S$$）。 - 提出了一种基于动力学的数学模型，结合了COD限制校正因子（$$f_{COD}$$）和DO抑制方程，以量化氮代谢网络。
GEMINI_zh_What_experiments_were_done_for: - 实验室规模的IAMR连续运行57天，处理经SBR预处理的猪场废水。 - 对COD、$$NH_4^+$$ -N、$$NO_2^-$$ -N、$$NO_3^-$$ -N、TKN、MLSS、MLVSS、TN、DO和pH进行化学分析。 - 对活性污泥进行宏基因组测序，以鉴定KEGG代谢途径和直系同源基因。 - 分三组进行动力学实验：1）$$NH_4^+$$ -N、$$NO_2^-$$ -N和COD好氧氧化中的氧吸收率（OUR）；2）好氧/厌氧条件下$$NH_4^+$$ -N、$$NO_2^-$$ -N和$$NO_3^-$$ -N的转化率；3）厌氧氨氧化与异养亚硝酸盐反硝化或硝酸盐呼吸的相互作用。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_points_that_can_b: - 将提出的基于动力学的数学模型和GA算法应用于全尺寸污水处理厂。 - 在波动的进水条件（例如，不同的COD/TN比或温度）下，同步PN/A和PDN/A工艺的长期稳定性。 - 进一步研究不同间歇曝气频率下的特定微生物群落动态及其相互作用。
GEMINI_zh_Summarize_the_main_points_of_t: - 成功构建了处理低COD/TN废水的单级IAMR的量化氮代谢网络。 - 开发了一种基于GA的新型算法来可靠地估计Monod动力学参数，克服了传统线性拟合的局限性。 - 同步短程硝化-厌氧氨氧化（PN/A）和短程反硝化-厌氧氨氧化（PDN/A）被确定为主要的脱氮途径（去除了58%~67%的氮）。 - 厌氧氨氧化的DO半抑制常数被校准为0.37 ~ 0.60 mg $$L^{-1}$$。 - 间歇曝气是抑制亚硝酸盐氧化菌（NOB）和防止$$NO_3^-$$ -N积累的关键措施。
